Koalisi Pejalan Kaki Tak Masalah JPO di Sudirman Tak Beratap
06 Nov 2019, 08:14 by Zunita Putri
Jakarta - Koalisi Pejalan Kaki mengaku tak masalah jika jembatan penyebrangan orang (JPO) di Sudirman, Jakarta, tak lagi beratap. Ia bahkan meminta Pemprov DKI Jakarta mengganti JPO dengan pelican crossing.
"Nggak masalah sepanjang ada penjelasan. Namanya pejalan kaki, kami selalu siap sedia payung untuk menahan panas dan hujan," kata aktivis Koalisi Pejalan Kaki, Ahmad Safrudin, saat dimintai tanggapan, Selasa (5/11/2019).
Bahkan, Ahmad mengatakan sebaiknya di Jakarta tidak ada lagi JPO dan digantikan dengan pelican crossing. Sebab menurut Ahmad, JPO adalah bentuk diskriminasi antara pejalan kaki dan pengendara motor atau mobil.
"Dan akan lebih baik lagi semua JPO dirobohkan dan diganti pelican crossing, karena JPO adalah bentuk diskriminasi bagi pejalan kaki (untuk menyeberang harus naik-turun tangga), sementara pengendara mobil diberi privilege untuk lalu lalang tanpa diganggu pejalan kaki yang menyeberang," katanya.
Sebelumnya diberitakan, salah satu jembatan penyeberangan orang (JPO) di Jalan Sudirman, Jakarta, kini tak lagi beratap. Ternyata Pemerintah Provinsi DKI Jakarta sengaja melepas atap JPO agar pejalan kaki bisa menikmati pemandangan kota tanpa penghalang.
"Jadi tidak hanya sebagai fungsi menyeberang, tapi jadi wahana bisa memandang Jakarta secara luas terbuka. Kan (pemandangan) gedung semua," ucap Kepala Dinas Bina Marga DKI Jakarta Hari Nugroho, saat dihubungi, Selasa (5/11).

Pedestrian Coalition is Not a Problem JPO in Sudirman has no roof
Nov 6 2019, 08:14 by Zunita Putri
Jakarta - The Pedestrian Coalition admitted that it is no problem if the bridge crossing people (JPO) in Sudirman, Jakarta, is no longer roofed. He even asked DKI Jakarta Provincial Government to replace JPO with pelican crossing.
"No problem as long as there is an explanation. The name is pedestrians, we are always ready to provide an umbrella to withstand heat and rain," said Pedestrian Coalition activist, Ahmad Safrudin, when asked for a response, Tuesday (11/05/2019).
In fact, Ahmad said that in Jakarta there should be no more JPOs and replaced with pelican crossing. Because according to Ahmad, JPO is a form of discrimination between pedestrians and motorists or cars.
"And it would be better if all JPOs were demolished and replaced by pelican crossing, because JPO is a form of discrimination for pedestrians (to cross must go up and down stairs), while motorists are given the privilege to travel without being disturbed by pedestrians who cross," he said.
Previously reported, one of the pedestrian crossing bridges (JPO) on Jalan Sudirman, Jakarta, now no longer has a roof. It turns out that the Provincial Government of DKI Jakarta deliberately removed the roof of the JPO so that pedestrians can enjoy the city view without obstructions.
"So it is not only a crossing function, but also a vehicle to see Jakarta widely open. It is not a view (view) of all buildings," said Head of DKI Jakarta Bina Marga Office Hari Nugroho, when contacted on Tuesday (11/5).
